Road closures and special event clearways will be in place in Mosman from Sunday 31 December 2017 to Monday 1 January 2018 for the New Year's Eve celebrations.

Roads in the vicinity of Mosman will begin closing at 3pm on Sunday 31 December and remain closed till 2am on Monday 1 January.
Police may restrict vehicle access along closed roads, including residents and businesses.

Motorists are advised to check signs before parking as vehicles in special event clearways will be towed and fines apply.

properties.headline: L'Etape Australia cycle - Saturday 2 December - KOSCIUSZKO NATIONAL PARK - BULLOCK FLATS TO PERISHER/JINDABYNE Kosciuszko Rd at Alpine Way
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: JINDABYNE - road closure and access map
BERRIDALE - road closure and access map
DALGETY - road closure and access map
ALL AREAS - road closure and access map

properties.otherAdvice:
L'Etape Australia Cycle Ride - by Le Tour De France

Over 3,500 riders will take part in one of two rides through the Snowy Mountains starting from Bullocks Flat in Perisher. The 157km course finishes on Kosciuszko Road at Perisher and the 126km course finishing at Jindabyne.

Road closures will be in place in Thredbo, Perisher, Jindabyne, RockyPoint, Berridale and Dalgety between 5.15am and 4.30pm. Key roads include Alpine Way, Eucumbene Rd, Kosciuszko Rd, Barry Way, Dalgety Rd and the Snow River Way.

Access arrangements:
- Police will manage access to/from Jindabyne via Kosciuszko Rd from 8.30am to 3pm.
- From Berridale/Dalgety access to Jindabyne between 5am and 7am via Dalgety Rd, Dalgety and Snowy River Way, Beloka only.
- From Berridale/Dalgety access to Jindabyne between 12:15pm and 2pm via Dalgety Rd only.
- Northbound traffic from Jincumbilly will be held at Dalgety until Snowy River Way reopens at 2pm.
- Westbound traffic from Cooma will be held at Berridale until Middlingbank Rd reopens at 10.50am.
- Local resident access maintained on Kosciuszko Rd from Berridale to Eucumbene Road, Hill Top from 6am to 10.50am.

arrangementElements.html:
THREDBO

From 5.30am to 8:30am

  • Alpine Way between Friday Drive (Thredbo Village) and Kosciuszko Road

JINDABYNE & BERRIDALE

From 5:15am to 9:15am

  • Kosciuszko Road(1, 2, 3) between Alpine Way and Eucumbene Road (westbound)

Notes:

1 Managed access to/from Jindabyne from 8:30am to 3pm. Follow Police and Traffic Control staff instructions at the location

2 Access to Jindabyne from Berridale via Dalgety detour between 5am and 7am.

3 Local resident access on Kosciuszko Road maintained from Berridale as far as Eucumbene Road.

JINDABYNE & ROCKY PLAINS

From 6:00am to 10:50am

  • Eucumbene Road between Kosciuszko Road and Rocky Plains Road
  • Rocky Plains Road between Eucumbene Road and Middlingbank Road

BERRIDALE

From 6:00am to 10:50am

  • Middlingbank Road between Kosciuszko Road and Rocky Plain Road
  • Jindabyne Road Between Middlingbank Road and Myack Street

From 6:00am to 12:45pm

  • Mayack Street between Kosciuszko Road and Dalgety Road

BERRIDALE & DALGETY

From 7:15am to 12:15pm

  • Campbell Street between Barnes Street and The Snowy River Way
  • Dalgety Road between Myack Street and Barnes Street

DALGETY & JINDABYNE

From 7:15am to 2pm

  • The Snowy River Way (4) between Dalgety Road and Barry Way

Note 4 - Between 7:15am and 2pm all westbound vehicles approaching Dalgety will be stopped at Dalgety until the road reopens. From 12:15pm vehicles will be able to travel to Jindabyne via Berridale

JINDABYNE

From 7:30am to 2:00pm

  • Barry Way (5) between The Snowy River Way and Kosciuszko Road

Note 5 - Managed access between Nettin Circuit and Reedys Cutting Road

JINDABYNE & PERISHER

From 8:30am to 4:30pm

  • Kosciuszko Road between Alpine Way and Perisher Village

properties.headline: Christmas Parade & Festival - Saturday 2 December - BERRY Queen St between Albert St and Edward St
properties.otherAdvice:
Berry Merry Christmas parade & festival from 5pm to 8pm

Queen St (Princes Hwy) will be closed between Albert St and Edward St from 5.30pm until 8pm for a Christmas street parade and festival.

The parade will take around 15 minutes and travel along Albany Street, Queen Street (the Princes Hwy) and Prince Alfred Street. Post-parade event activities will be held on Queen St until 8pm. Other local roads including Alexandra St will also be closed for the event.

Local detours will be in place while roads are closed. Berry Bypass will not be affected. Motorists should allow extra travel time when driving through the area and follow direction of NSW Police and traffic controllers onsite.

properties.headline: Motorcycle Convoy event - Sunday 3 December - STOCKTON TO WICKHAM Nelson Bay Rd to Industrial Dr/Hannell St
properties.otherAdvice:
40th Anniversary Bikers for Kids Newcastle Toy Run - from 10am to 12pm

Up to 10,000 motorcycles are expected to take part in the convoy so delays are expected on roads along the route during the event, and also prior to the event as riders make their way to the start area in Stockton between 8am and 10am.

The motorcycle convoy will start from Fullerton St at Stockton, and travel to Wickham Park, Wickham via Nelson Bay Rd, Teal St, Cormorant Rd, across the Tourle St bridge, Industrial Dr/Hannell St, Branch St and Albert St.

NSW Police will escort the convoy and traffic control crews will be onsite assisting with traffic movements. Motorists should exercise caution and allow extra travel time when driving through the area.

Post-event activities will be hosted at the finish area in Hawkins Oval, Wickham Park until around 3pm.

properties.headline: NSW State Touch Cup - 1-3 December - PORT MACQUARIE Hastings River Dr at Boundary St
properties.otherAdvice:
Temporary road closures may take place along Hastings River Drive and surrounding local sports fields during the event.

Traffic controllers will be in place at the intersection of Hastings River Drive and Boundary Street for traffic management throughout the event.
properties.diversions: Motorists are advised to avoid the area and can use the Oxley Highway as an alternative route.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Post event clearways and closures map 26-30 Nov

properties.otherAdvice:
Supercars Coates Hire Newcastle 500 - circuit deconstruction until 7pm Thursday 30 November.

Changed traffic conditions are in effect until 7pm on Thursday 30 November while circuit and event infrastructure is removed.

Watt Street bus terminal remains closed until 7pm Thu 30 Nov. Buses will return to normal routes and stop at Watt Street bus terminal after 7pm on Thursday.

One-way traffic arrangements remain in place on various roads in the east-end until 7pm Thu 30 Nov.

Special event clearway parking restrictions remain in effect on Bolton St, Church St and Newcomen St until 7pm Thu 30 Nov. Check signs carefully for timings. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL Cricket: Sydney Sixers v Perth Scorchers at the SCG from 12pm

Traffic may be heavier than normal around Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Motorists should expect delays on roads approaching Moore Park including Cleveland St, Flinders St, Anzac Pde, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads around Moore Park from midday until 9pm. Check signs carefully when parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Driver Ave may close before, during and after the event to safely move crowds around the precinct.

properties.headline: Christmas Festival - Friday 15 December - INVERELL Gwydir Hwy (Otho St) between Evans St and Byron St
properties.otherAdvice:
Inverell Festival of Christmas from 6pm to 9pm

Gwydir Hwy (Otho St) will be closed between Evans St and Byron St from 3pm to 10pm on Friday for a Christmas festival.

Local detours will be in place. Motorists should allow extra travel time through the area and exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be higher than normal on local streets.

properties.headline: New Year's Eve - Dee Why & Manly - DEE WHY & MANLY various roads
properties.publicTransport: The best way to enjoy New Year's Eve is to use public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Special event clearways and road closures map - Northern Beaches

properties.otherAdvice:
New Year's Eve - Dee Why & Manly

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place around Dee Why and Manly on Sunday 31 December 2017.

Roads around the Northern Beaches will begin closing at 4pm and remain closed until 10:30pm.
Police may restrict vehicle access along closed roads, including residents and businesses.

Special event clearways will be in place from 3pm until 10pm on Sunday 31 December.
Motorists are advised to check signs before parking as vehicles in special event clearways will be towed and fines apply.

properties.headline: New Year's Eve - Greenwich - GREENWICH Greenwich Rd at Bay St
properties.publicTransport: The best way to enjoy New Year's Eve is to use public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
New Years Eve - Greenwich

Road closures will be in place in Greenwich from Sunday 31 December 2017 to Monday 1 January 2018 for the New Year's Eve celebrations.

Greenwich Road south of Bay Street and Chisholm Street south of Edwin Street will be closed from 5:30pm on Sunday 31 December and remain closed till 2am on Monday 1 January.

Closure conditions:
5:30pm-6pm: residents and their visitors will be allowed to enter the road closures (with appropriate proof of address)
6pm onwards: no access will be allowed into the road closures for anyone, including residents, with the exception of emergency services;
Vehicles will be permitted to exit the road closure 9:00 pm onwards after a safety assessment of all pedestrian and vehicle movements and other potential hazards has been conducted by on site NSW Police officers. This assessment may result in longer wait periods. Vehicles will be allowed to enter the road closure after 2:00am.

properties.headline: Sia concert - Saturday 2 December - MOORE PARK various roads near Allianz Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from Central Station. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Central to Moore Park walking map
Sia - closures and special event clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Sia concert at Allianz Stadium from 6pm

Traffic will be heavy around Moore Park as thousands of fans make their way to Allianz Stadium on Saturday evening.

Delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park including Cleveland St, Flinders St, Anzac Pde, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads around Moore Park from midday to midnight. Check signs carefully when parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

For the safety of crowds leaving the area, the westbound lanes of Moore Park Rd between Oxford St and Driver Ave will close between 9:30pm and 11:30pm.

Driver Ave may close before, during and after the concert to safely move crowds around the precinct.
